item.title: The whole stretch of Morley Avenue/St John’s Avenue, 17th May
item.description:
White line markings completed along this road on Friday 16th May in the evening. Yellow box repainted on Parton Road. Why wasn’t the rest of the awfully faded yellow lines re painted at the same time ?! This was promised several years ago ! The parking on the corners & blind bends is now dangerous - yellow lines are needed asap.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Morley Avenue, Churchdown, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: General road markings, lines and stud issues

item.title: Street light required in street and parking area., 17th May
item.description:
In front of house no. 15,17,19 and 21 William Gough Close Cheltenham GL510QL and the parking arer of these houses. There are four houses in this street and 12 people living there including 3 elderly people, 2 autistic kids and 3 other kids, 4 adults. In the night it was very drak, the visibility was zero and the kids and elderly people have risk of fall all the time. My mother and kids fallen six times in the street last winter because it's too dark. These houses don't have drive way, have had allocated parking space on the street and there was also no street light. It's my humble request to council please install 2 lights, one on the street and one in the parking place. Please respond ASAP.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 13, William Gough Close, Hesters Way, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
